Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: J L
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel wasn't quite as described, and I have to admit that the surrounding area was a bit disconcerting at night time for a lone traveller. The Sagrada definitely wasn't 'just metres away' it was a good 10 to 15 minute walk, but then you can use the metro, which is just a stones throw from the hotel. The staff were very helpful and pleasant and the room was fine, and perfectly clean. There was a great selection at breakfast time. Dinner was a different matter, not really much of a selection, plus, as this hotel seems to be popular with school/college tour groups, other 'residents' were seated outside the main dining area in a coffe bar type of area. Would have been nice to have had kettle/coffee in the room but then perhaps not having them is the norm in Spain? The only issue I had was on being charged 10 euros to access my room earlier, as the flight had landed earlier than expected. I was given the option of sitting in the reception area for 30 minutes rather than having to pay, but as I'd been travelling since 4 a.m. I just wanted to crash! otherwise, it was a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: D00rman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was overall good. Very clean, calm and peacefull. The staff was very friendly and informative. The breakfast was adequate, nothing fancy. There are 2 cons: 1) the rooms are very small, and the door to balcony(if you have one in your room) does not open. 2) Located relatively far from city centre(Ramble's)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tanerism
Reviews.Content: I have been there for three nights in 2009 February and had a nice stay overall. The condition of the room was not bad and the staff looked helpful. They served a great breakfast but they need to improve or renovate their rooms etc. Location was nice as well just 5-10 min away to Las Ramblas. I would stay there once again with no hesitation...

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative for business travel”
Reviews.Author: SimonandNeda
Reviews.Content: The Catalonia Aragón is billed as a 3-star hotel in central Barcelona. We found it clean, good value for money and relatively quiet. Plus points are certainly the free Wifi throughout the hotel and comfortable beds. The restaurant is fine for breakfast but we weren't very impressed at other times...having said that there's plenty of choices nearby. One slight snag for business travellers however, they seem to turn off the cooling capabilities of the A/C in winter. As a result on mild winter days the room can get quite warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: brettanthony
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews about this hotel I was slightly worried about what to expect, however I was pleasently surprised with the quality of service and standards of the hotel. Overall the hotel was excellent cheap drinks and restuarant prices and the continental breakfast was very good with plenty of choice... Also very clean and modern rooms , staff are freindly and most speak english and the free wifi is great..... If im being fussy it is apparent to me that sunday evenings in the hotel bar area seems to be a meeting point for the local homosexuals...... !

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: rinat r
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to Barcelona to hotel Catalonia Aragon, at ten PM, we expected to receive a room which answers our reservation details: a non-smoking double bed room. In reality, we received a twin room with a hard smell of smoking. Of course they apologized saying that that is the only room available, but after we asked to talk with the manager, somehow a room with a decent odor was available. Unfortunately, after changing this first room, we found out that the toilet seat was not clean and we had to clean it ourselves in the middle of the night. The next day we had to change the room again since the window was at the same hight as the exterior level, inviting the common burglar. The alternative room on the 9th floor had a broken window but looked harder to break. Unfortunately again, the sink was filled with water. The 'kind' woman in the reception dismissed a 'no worries' note and we went back to travel the city. We shouldn't have been surprised to find out that nothing had been done to fix the problem because: "when did you report the problem? 18:00?! oh, because the 'sink technician' just left at 18:00 and...." In addition: Unsafe area (pickpockets) Lack of courtesy in the service Many of the guests changed their rooms during their stay, clearly a waste of time!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “just for couples”
Reviews.Author: Kami l
Reviews.Content: the room was small and are NOT suitable for more than 2 persons. I took a room for triple which was the same room with an extra bed in it and it was dense. the room maintenance was very poor, the toilet was shaking, the ceiling had signed of previous wetness problem and the walls cover was falling. the elevator to the 9th floor could not carry more than 2 persons although it supposed to hold 450kg. breakfast was excellent and the the hotel was clean and the team was polite. Not something to miss to.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: panasia
Reviews.Content: We spent almost a week at this place! Location wise, it is out of central area where most sites to visit are. But is very close to the Clot metro station which is also a train station. Renfe, the train company, has a train going from Clot to the Barcelona airport for 3.15 Euro in about 30 minutes. There is nothing interesting around the hotel. The room is fairly sized, clean and bright, the bed is comfortable with lots of pillows (3 per person). AC is quiet at low speed, but thermostat control need some calibration as it is not precise. Bathroom is OK, lots of hot water. There is no fridge however! Wi-fi is free. Use of the in-room is 5 Euro per day and requires a deposit of 50 Euro for the lock barrel. Insulation is quite bad overall, even from street noise as Arago is a busy street. People talking in the hall can be heard quite clearly in the room. There is a special breakfast rate of 3.5 Euro (Juice, Sandwich or croissant or eggs, coffee) if the room rate does not include the morning breakfast buffet. Even there is a billboard advertsing a 64 Euro per night on the building side, we paid around 100 Euro per night via booking.com depending on the day of the week. It is a no frills hotel with reasonable price with easy access to downtown via the metro system.

Reviews.Title: “noisy and dirty street”
Reviews.Author: wolf_gray
Reviews.Content: The hotel located on the noisy and dirty street. The air conditioner was noisy, but effective. Elevators (nine floors) are small and slow. Also the stairs. Breakfast acceptable. The hotel gives Wifi internet free, but very small safe box costs 5 euro per day. The snack bar offers good and cheap lunches - 10 euro, in clean and pretty atmosphere. Desktop is too little for work with laptop and papers. Bidet absent.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience fair location”
Reviews.Author: HadyMans
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience staying in this hotel, the rooms are quiet large and very organized and clean. the breakfast buffet has big variety of food and pastries. the stuff were very nice and happy to help at any time. has a free WiFi which is a big plus while being abroad. its within less than 5 min walk from the metro and the train station so you can come and go when ever you like. its location however is kinda far from the center, its about 4 stops from the Catalonia square. its about 15-20 min walk from the sagrada familia the location of the hotel is in a quiet neighborhood and has nothing to do around the hotels (hotels,bars and such) over all I will be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it and most likely will book again”
Reviews.Author: Gkeya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an area that is accessible by metro and buses (I personally used metro) within walking distance (about 6 blocks) from Sagrada Familia. The city center is 5 metro stations away

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: maaianr
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend in a last minute deal, and the hotel was really good. beautiful and clean rooms, great food and nice stuff. the hotel was near the metro, like 150meter from. the breakfast was delicious with a lot of verity. great hotel for people who want to travel all over Barcelona and relax at night in a quiet place. I recommend it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and courteous service”
Reviews.Author: ronmish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 days And we enjoyed very much staying in the hotel .and service attitude of the staff was courteous.The hotel's location just fine. Metro station 2 minutes walk away.Rooms are spacious and room service quick and efficient.Breakfast at the rich and varied and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Metro, Rooms not maintained well”
Reviews.Author: Selvakumar1971
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the Metro Station, but the bathroom is not maintained well, water is seeping to the desk area, electronic lock ( door access card ) was not working well, but no solution from the staff, safe ( locker ) is 5 Euros per night,

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel, cheap but far from more popular areas"”
Reviews.Author: karmakola_001
Reviews.Content: my husband and me have been to Barcelona before , back in 2009 and the hotel we stayed at earlier was just fabulous and the location was perfect. But this time we were on a tight budget and wanted to not spend that kind of amount for a hotel. so after a lot of searching and researching, we zeroed in on Catalonia Aragon , which I believe comes under a chain of hotels. The rooms are basic, clean although a little small and you can hear all the voices in the corridor because maybe the soundproofing isn't right. The hotel is just what you expect a three star to be. The hotel is located near Sagrada Familia and the metro stop you need to take is Clot which is a four five minute walk to the Hotel, the metro in Barcelona is open till pretty late and the night bus service is also quite extensive so its never a problem to get around in that city at night even if you don't want to take a taxi. the hotel is at least two train changes to las ramblas or barcelonetta. The rooms would be cleaned everyday and towels along with the other linen would be changed daily. The staff is friendly and can even speak English. We never tried the restaurant downstairs but it would always be full so i gather it must be good. All in all, i don't mind how the hotel was but it was slightly off location wise for me as I prefer staying where I can walk to most things or take a bike.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: AlleyR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Aragon on my first trip to Barcelona. I didn’t organise airport transfers but getting to the hotel from the airport was fairly simple and straightforward by train and only 40mins away. I can honestly say that it was a clean hotel with friendly staff and good hotel amenities. The rooms were spacious and bright and although my room was situated on the side of a busy road I didn’t mind the occasional noise in the morning. The breakfast buffet was extremely good value for money with a wide variety of foods and served in a clean area. I was pleased with the general positive atmosphere in the hotel and felt good to unwind in my room after a long day. The only complaint I can think of would be that it’s not in an ideal location and a lot of money was spent on cab fares but overall I was pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “11 out of 10!!!”
Reviews.Author: OhadB
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 10 days trip to Barcelona (I stayed 9 nights at this hotel) and want to share with you my review. The hotel is within two minutes walking from "Clot" station of the metro (lines L1 and L2) and also the train to the airport (which is a cheap and realiable alternative to taxis; by the way: use your T-10 when taking the train to the airport instead of buying a 3 Euros one way ticket). And one last thing about the location: notice that a very good supermarket ("Condis") is located very close to the hotel (also in Arago street, ask the receptionist to show you). The recpetionists were very polite and efficient. I got my room more than two hours before the official check-in time (but I guess that this is subject to availability). My room was an internal one, very quite and also very clean and comfortable. As everyone here said the breakfast was just GREAT!!! Notice that they also have a "snack bar" which offers some great dishes for decent prices, so if you're tired and don't want to get out in the evening for a dinner remember thet you have this option. Several of the items on the menu can also be ordered to your room. Please feel free to ask for more details and clarification by sending me a private message.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel. easy to go”
Reviews.Author: josi50
Reviews.Content: this is a small hotel near the metro. it's very easy to visit the city. the room are o.k. clean. the breakfast is good' a lot of choise and good expresso coffee. the receptionist are very helpfull and explained every things we ask. the only thing that can stop me to go back is that they took away the mini bar ??? we saw the place were it should have been but it was not there. that's a stupid thing to do

Reviews.Title: “Its realy very friendly holet within small budget”
Reviews.Author: akzaman
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Barcelona with my 13months old young babay and wife. We entered holtel at midnight and the person on reciption was directly helpout to reach our room by carrying all baggage...Room is good and well cleaned (We was in Room No 142) Only missing was minibar. Location is also wellconnected to Metro and BUS. I specially like the hotel because for my baby I use their kitchen to store milk and baby foods. Staffs are friendly too. I booked the hotel for 2 days and next 2 days to another hotel.....but my wife was telling Aragon is so cool for its location and budget is also affordable for us. But we dont prefer Breakfast its costly inside hotel even I saw they was offering lots of items as bufet. I recommended this hotel as I have good experience specially WIFI was really very speedy to make voice chat and VOIP call to my contracts...

Reviews.Title: “10 min walk from Sagrada Familia, but pretty far from the downtown..”
Reviews.Author: MyskaHryzka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Sagrada Familia. For the downtown you need to take metro. The food in the hotel was good, not so expensive. Receptionists were helpful. What I found annoying was noise made by housekeeping in the morning. We were also missing the mini bar. Nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel - especially on a tight budget”
Reviews.Author: balster
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, decent rooms, quiet - could not hear the road. Breakfast buffet was really good - special offer if you pay every morning at the restaurant half price - excellent. Beer in the bar took ages to arrive after I ordered some in the evening. They served Newky Brown which was served at the right temperature. Watch out for the killer tax though. But the Bar Manager was really nice and he was very talkative. Room got a bit cold at night and the hotel staff could not find any spare ones. The tube was 5 mins walk away - on the red line. There is a large ish shopping centre called Glories which is about 10 min walk away and the wife bought loads of shoes from there!! Take the tour bus trips for days, green and orange lines - they will save you a load of money, just hop on and back on again. The hotel security guard could not stop a pigeon walking into the hotel. He looked mean, but that was it. Very secure hotel, pillows were to to thin - i asked for another pillow but they could not find any - but they did try, the curtains were super thick and no light got into the room. Hotel staff were all very friendly, apart from a miserable lady on reception who had blondish hair.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, best breakfast in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: AventuraBird
Reviews.Content: Terrible front desk staff, rude and unfriendly!!! But not at the restaurant, very nice maître and waiters. Amazing breakfast for 7 euros! Excellent bottles of wine for 5 euros! For the price that we payed, it worthed it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good breakfast, ok room”
Reviews.Author: majmani
Reviews.Content: I happened to stay in Hotel Catalonia Aragon for 3 nights and i think it was awesome. Ok, it took the reception more than 30minutes to check us in since they were doing a checkin of a huge group and there was only one lady at the reception. She could speak in good english, and did check us in within 15minutes. Room was ordinary, furniture old, and no mini bar or refrigerator. Washroom was bigger compared to most of the hotels and just alright. Our window was facing the main road, but we never were disturbed by the noises, or didn't even know there were any noise. The best part of staying in this hotel was breakfast. It was awesome with hot eggs / bacons / sausages cooked at the counter. If you go a little late, you might have to wait a little before getting a table. Their restaurant closes by 1030pm, which is quite early. Internet was free in the room, so bit more convenient. Couple of supermarkets just 1 block away, which is always good to have. Hotel is located pretty close to Clot railway station. No worries if you arrive by train, or at the airport. Just take the train to Clot, and when you exit the station, you can see a set of traffic signals around. Look for a restaurant named Asiatica (Chinese cuisine) and just cross the road. You will see the street signage for Aragon and in less than 200 meters you would be at the hotel. Sagrada Familia can be reached by walk, it took us 30minutes though. There is a residential area in the neighbourhood and a walk is around the hotel area is highly recommended. Staff was just ok. I felt that the air conditioning unit was not cooling properly, to which i got the response that this is the max is works. Again, we were in Barcelona to see the city and not spend the entire day at the hotel. Our stay was good, comfortable and without any hassles. Get your metro T10 card and get ready to discover barcelona. Next time i might look for another location, which is closer to gothic area, but this is out of my personal interest!

Reviews.Title: “5 star service at a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ersinyx
Reviews.Content: Simply the best choice and value for the amount you pay. Hotel is located in a semi-local semi-touristic zone called "Clot". Look it over in the map, you will see the clot metro station two minutes walk away from it. Rooms are perfectly clean, toilets and showers are not much different than a regular 5 star hotel. Breakfast is perfect in one word. What is the bad thing? Well, do not look for a view thru window as there is not. Well, I will definetely go visit Barcelona again as 3 days were not enough to discover and taste everything and no doubt I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I would never recommend anyone staying at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaDyno
Reviews.Content: I will give it to you in a nut shell. The hotel is old and not kept up very well above the ground floor. I have traveled throughout Europe and have never stayed in a hotel this bad. Problems: mold in the bathroom shower/floor, rooms claustrophobic they are so small, bathroom floor squeeked so loud it woke up anyone else in the room, hairdryer handle was sticky and dirtry (used a hand towel to wrap around the handle to use), no electrical adaptors available for 110V electrical equipment (they ought to get with the times, Italy has 15 yrs ago when we were there), a bucket of ice will cost you 1.5 Euros, the in room safe to use is 5 Euros/day and a $50 Euro deposit. The staff was very unfriendly and rude. I stayed in room 212 on July 16 and 17, 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, but stay elsewhere...”
Reviews.Author: tmunhoz
Reviews.Content: Depending on the purpose of my trip maybe I can stay in a hostel, I stay in a hotel when I am working, do not want to go out, really need to rest. That was the case BUT this hotel is so noisy, the rooms are not properly clean and the staff (not all of them of course) so rude (particularly in the restaurant....) I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. The area it is located has nothing, not even a reasonable restaurant. Stay elsewhere....

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: dng08
Reviews.Content: Less then 100 m distance from metro (Clot station). walking distance from sagrada familia. room size average. shower but no bath. free wireless in room. safe. no mini bar. resturant. breakfast not include. friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mind the inside noise!”
Reviews.Author: Pisets
Reviews.Content: Dear travellers! I wouldn't say "avoid this hotel" - in general, it's ok. All written below is true - clean, nice, friendly atmosphere. BUT ONLY if you sleep very soundly, without awakening and shuddering from the frequent bang of your neighbours' doors (who often happen to be the teenagers group having a party at 2 am) and without cursing when all of a sudden there is a tremendous thunder at your ceiling - which happens to be someone else's floor and this someone obviuosly dropped the wardrobe or a tv at 3 am, and after that started walking in the high heels there and back in the room (though there is practically no place to walk) - THEN this hotel suits you. True, there is no OUTSIDE noise from the streets, crowds and traffic. But INSIDE you can hear everything. One of our neighbours had coughing fits at night - practically every half an hour - we were very sorry for her when we woke each time. And even good earplugs do not help here. The walls and floors are not sound proof at all!! Just a warning for those who care to rest at night before daily excursions, shopping or whatever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, friendly staff, GREAT breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 1Michelle1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to a Metro. It is very clean. Windows are sound proof so you can not here the trafic and you can have a peacefull nights sleep. Breakfast is nice. staff is friendly. In general I like the hotel and would recomend to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “A simple yet fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ZeebsLondon
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner both really enjoyed our stay at the Aragon Hotel. It was clean, spacious, had lovely minimal decor, the shower was excellent, the breakfast buffet was FANTASTIC (probably the best part) and it was located 3 minutes away from the metro, so very easy to get to from the airport and city centre. It was a 3 star hotel, however, and not worth paying an extortionate price for, so I probably wouldn't have been AS pleased if I had paid a lot for our room. But if you're on a budget and want to stay somewhere decent then I'd definitely recommend the Aragon Hotel. I've stayed in many 3 star hotels in the past and this was definitely one of the best. If I have to make any complaints, I would say that the rooms were ocassionally a little cold and that the cleaner (some mornings) made a bit of noise outside our room (but then again, we were slightly unlucky in that we were given a room right next to cleaning cupboard). All in all, we had a GREAT stay at Aragon and would certainly stay there again if we didn't want to pay too much for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Razzmataz
Reviews.Content: Large room, very clean, excellent breakfast buffet, close to metro. Front desk staff speaks English and was very helpful. Location is a bit off the beaten track, but metro access more than compensates. Friendly people. Overall, a very positive experience. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean to stay”
Reviews.Author: SeanDillon
Reviews.Content: I have been there just last week with a last minute decision of barcelona trip. I was a little curious but as it has a direct transportation from and to airport,which is a big advantage.just 1 minute walk to Clot (red line) metro station,also at nights cheap taxi drive will take you there.Rooms are a little bit old style,without minibar or split clima or flat tv but for this price air conditioning and room interiors were more than enough. I recommend this hotel to easy travellerss!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: dangtwyn2
Reviews.Content: It was very very clean and metro was only 1 or 2 minute walk . when you get off the metro look for a big HOTEL sign in yellow letters and follow it. its the hotel sign to the hotel next to the Aragon. But at least it is easy to find. Very convenient. Located only 5 min walk away from the Glories shopping area that has a great local peoples flea mkt in the morning that is huge and then there is also a huge mall w a carrefours (walmartish) attached to it. it has a H&M store and Strabucks out of all places there. if you like garage sale type of flea mkts this is the place. so close to the hotel. it isnt mentioned much in the travel books. at night there are a couple of nearby small eateries to dine at. safe area. there ar 2 other hotels next to each other so you see tourists near by too. for a clean safe place w fast wifi and a tv that has 3 english channels not bad for $79euros.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE, FAR LOCATION, choose another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: albiceleste33
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel at one price and 3 days later the price dropped 25 euros per night! When I told them about this they responded with a short email saying "the price that was agreed to will be charged" when I know for a fact that nothing is paid until the end of the hotel stay. I talked to 5 different people, none of whom were helpful and all of whom said that on Saturday the reservations team would be present to help with my questions and that surely there was something that could be done. On Saturday when I asked to speak with reservations, the rude woman at the front desk looked at me and said "It's saturday, they don't work on saturdays." Needless to say I was angry. I even asked them if they could throw in breakfast to justify the rapid price change and they simply said "No," somewhat mocking my request. When I asked if they had the bus schedule to the airport they A) told me the buses didn't run on Sundays, which was not true, B) Told me I had to wait in line (a loooong 30 min line) to check out even though I explained I had to catch the bus and was going to miss my plane (which ended up happening, thanks to the fact that there was ONE person working the front desk on a Sunday during check out time), and C) They had no idea what the bus schedule was. I was sick and tired of their lack of service (only one man was nice, the one that works at night) and the hotel is way overpriced for what it was. It is FAR from everything. The metro is close but you waste SO much time on the metro and, in the end, money (imagine 1,35 euros each way, although there are 10 ride passes or day passes, it adds up fast). It is not within walking distance of anything, despite what they say. The rooms were clean, which was the only good thing about the hotel. I'm definitely staying somewhere else and maybe booking at the last minute if it's low season.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: gilesandjenny
Reviews.Content: Hotel Catalonia has an excellent location being just 3 minutes walk from Clot Metro station on the Red Line. Not being in centre of city it also has less traffic noise. The rooms are clean, comfortable but basic, for instance there is no mini-bar or tea/coffee making facilities. We had two queen beds which were comfortable but I found the long thing bolster pillow very uncomfortable especially as I normally sleep with 2 pillow and there were no spares. The first night our room on 2nd floor had a bath with shower but was very noisy at as a group of young people were staying on the same floor partying into the night! We complained and the staff were extremely helpful and moved us to 4th floor rooms, lovely and quiet. The new room had a walk-in shower with no bath. The staff were always very pleasant and helpful in this hotel. The breakfast buffet was adequate with plenty of choice plus a chef cooking fresh eggs dishes. There is a refreshment bar serving coffee and drinks all day and an evening restaurant service. This has a very limited a la carte menu but reasonably priced and cooked nicely. Would we stay at this hotel again? Yes, definitely but I would make sure to ask for a quiet room away from any groups. This hotel is so convenient, the Red Line Metro takes you to into the centre of Barcelona very speedily and is easy to negotiate. If you fly into Gerona and arrive in Barcelona Nord Bus station it is then only 3 stops on the metro to Hotel Catalonia.

Reviews.Title: “excellent buffet”
Reviews.Author: SaskatchewanMaggie
Reviews.Content: My stay here was pleasant. The hotel is clean and quiet with good service. Location is handy to the metro. The best part was the breakfast and dinner buffet - lots of choice, delicious food and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Pedersen_Denmark
Reviews.Content: All in all very good, clean hotel in nice surraoundings. Surely recommendable. What I liked best was the breakfast. It was a buffet with everything you want from english to contiental breakfast. Location Close to la Sagrada Familie. About 5-7 min. walk. 2-3 min. walk to the metro station Clot (red line 1 goes to the inner city. It takes about 8 min. to Placa de Catalunya) Service The service was without big problems. The staff was not overly friendly but they greeted us. Room The room was clean but pretty dark. We had a balcony whick we could not enter because there was no door.

Reviews.Title: “a good and cheap stay..”
Reviews.Author: taneryildiz
Reviews.Content: the staff, breakfast and the location was good. just get to the metro from clot and you will be in las ramblas in 5 minutes. TV needs to be more global. free wireless access was wonderful for us. it was such a stunning stay for me. if i go to barcelona again i would stay there for sure...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for someone wanting a safe, clean place to rest”
Reviews.Author: deanerxxx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in this hotel. We were kinda worried about running into a problem with a taxi not being able to find this hotel, but evey taxi knew its location. In a cab, it would cost about 10-15 euros to get to the placa square(top of la rambla) , less than 5euros to sagrada. The area is a quiet area, you can walk up the street and find some resteurants and little shopping area. The front desk staff could speak english, so no worries. However , it wouldn't hurt for them to smile! They served us, but weren't very outgoing, or looking to do anything extra for you. It was never mentioned to us about breakfast being included in our stay. Which is satisfiy, its a buffet with a nice variety. You pay 5e a day for the safe. The rooms were really clean, everything seemed to work ok. I would recommend this hotel because for the price it was a great deal, clean, and quiet. I would recommend if you are staying there for a while and not wanting to walk far, get a cab to sagrada for 5euros, and get the hop off hop on bus tour across the street from the main entrance. You buy the ticket on the bus, its great way to see the city and cheaper than taking a cab everywhere. Or just get out and walk, ENJOY Barcelona, its a beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel Far from Bitten Track”
Reviews.Author: Matiola
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed 3 nights in this hotel. Overall it was a nice experience: spacious room, great breakfast, nice friendly stuff. Fast Internet ia available inside Lobby (pay by Credit Card required). It was very quiet at night. The location is near Sagrada Familia, but is far away from the center of Barcelona. Still a very good deal!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: effinald
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 4 minutes walk from clot metro. It takes about 20 mins from the hotel (by metro) to get to the main attractions apart from sagrada familia which can be walked in 15 mins. The room was large and clean, as was the bathroom. (6th floor) The area seemed ok,if a bit run down. The toilet did not flush properly which the hotel sorted out quickly. The staff are efficient, if not overly friendly. eg i am not sure if the one of the female receptionists had the ability to smile. however, a couple of the staff were friendly and all were helpful. breakfast was quite nice with a selection of pastries and cereals and coffee, and some hot options. (no bacon) The hotel is clean, and there were no noise issues, although perhaps this was due to the time of year. there appears to only ever be one person on reception which is a bit of a problem with a hotel this size. clot metro is on red line 1 and purple line 2 which allows for easy access to the things to see. when arriving, leave the station from the red line at exit sortida arago. the hotel also provides dinner which we did not have.

Reviews.Title: “Never seen something like it”
Reviews.Author: t00ks
Reviews.Content: The hotel advertises a 3 star rating, but it should be a 1 star. First the location is bad and far away from city attractions, only Sagrada Familia is near. The elevators are a disaster and you cannot get to your room if you do not take the right one. Hallways are dark as are the stairs. You have to be a circus acrobat to get across the room without tripping with the bed,suitcases, given the narrow and angular design of the room. The bathroom was huge, but the toilet paper dispenser was located at the opposite wall from the toilet, so that was a problem if one did not take the paper beforehand. The front desk personal is unhelpful,with a take or leave it attitude, and the same applies to the restaurant . The price for the safe was insane. I will never recommend this place to anybody

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greta_greta76
Reviews.Content: I spent in this hotel 3 nights. - Hotel : nice hotel, clean and quiet rooms + location -Breakfast: was not included, it costs ca 12 Euros but nearby there is a backer and cafeterias which are very cheap ( coffe+ croissant from Eur. 1.40 to Eur 2,00) - Location: walking distance to the sagrada familia ( 10 minutes) - while one hour walking to Passage de Gracia but there are 2 metro lines ( the red and the violet one) which lead in 10 minutes to the city centre. - The metro is 2/3 minutes far from the hotel. -From the airport you can take the local train RENFE directly to passage de Gracia and change to the violet metro. ( total cost Eur. 2,60) I suggest to take the T 10 ticket, for 7.20 Eur for 10 Metro + bus tickets. ( onle single ticket costs Eur. 1,30) Yuo can use it for the RENFE train too.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a surprise”
Reviews.Author: sitesee3
Reviews.Content: It was quite a surprise. The Hotel was Nice, Breakfast was excellent. Our room was very quiet and clean with almost no noise from the outside which was a surprise from everything I read about this hotel, but we did run into Problems. Our room Central Air conditioner did not work, which was very inconvient as it was +34 C outside, Hotel was full so we couldn't change rooms and the Front Desk forgot to book our ride back to the Airport that we requested the night before which made us navigate the Metro and Bus system at 5:30 a.m. They did not seem interested in helping us and made it sound like it was my fault for not booking the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: scm1133
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catalona Aragon for 3 nights and were pleasantly surprised with the experience at the hotel. It was a lovely stay. Having read numerous reviews, we were a bit reluctant, but it worked out. Customer Service: It was impeccable - the front desk staff were as helpful as possible, some more than others, but always to the best of their ability. They checked tickets for concerts, bullfights, and looked into dinner reservations. Location: Some reviews noted that the hotel was far away - it depends on what you are looking to do and where you are planning to go - we found the hotel very accessible. It is a 2 minute walk to Clot metro station, which is on the L2 and very well connected without needing multiple transfers. That said, given the nice weather, we took a few nice walks to La Sagrada Familia and even all the way to Las Ramblas and did not find it too much trouble - it was a great location. We were able to see a few less touristy spots and eat a few more authentic meals than if we'd stayed directly in the city center. We stayed for 4 full days and did not use up our T-10 metro cards! Despite the fact that everyone raved about the breakfast - we did not eat it, instead, we opted for amazing .65 croissants at the bakery just 1 block past the hotel (away from the metro) - amazing, fresh, and much better than the 12 euro option at the hotel! Also, 'Isabels' is a local convenient store - .77 for a 1.5L bottle of water - if you are walking into town, better to buy it there, because at La Sagrada Familiar the same bottle was 2.50 euros. Booking: We booked on laterooms.com where the rate was substantially lower than the website and expedia. Then, I emailed the reservation staff at the Aragon, who emailed back promptly and worked with me to ensure that the room had 2 beds pushed together so that my boyfriend and I did not have to sleep across the room - very very helpful. Then, reservations surprised me by sending an envelope of 'Barcelona' information - tours, exhibits, etc to my apartment, which arrived before we left so that we could start to plan out our trip. We hope this helps! We would definitely return to the hotel - clean, modern, and very refreshing!

Reviews.Title: “nice comfy hotel in quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Benfromsydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for one night. The hotel is clean, modern and has a nice atmosphere. The shower in our room was big enough to have a party in and the although we didnt try the breakfast it looked very nice. It was an easy walk to get to the metro and then onwards to rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BurnistonLamb
Reviews.Content: We were transferred from the adjacent Hotel Albeniz, and we probably received better value at this hotel. The bedroom smelt a little smoky, and was fairly small, but it was clean and comfortable, with a modern bathroom, with both bath and shower. There was plenty of choice at the breakfast buffet, with omelettes available, cooked to order, as well as the usual selection of food. We did receive an unnecessarily surly reception when we arrived before 7.30.a.m. on Saturday; breakfast is served half-an-hour later at weekends. The hotel is a very short walk from the Clot Metro station, and we saved a lot of time and money by purchasing five-day travel tickets (which permit access to bus and metro.) This was our third visit to Barcelona, and it gets better each time, with so much to see, and such beautiful colours. This time we included a tour of the fantastic Palau Musica de Catalunya, and also participated in an excusion to Montserrat, Sitges and a winery, as well as visiting the normal Gaudi haunts. Hotel Aragon was fine for our purpose. Our only complaint about the holiday was having to fly home at the end !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Barcelona touring”
Reviews.Author: flaguy
Reviews.Content: I spent a week and was happy with my stay. I debated between 3 & 4 stars and decided on a "low 4" star rating. I had a small room on the top floor (9th) that had obviously been redone recently. There was a double bed, desk with TV, chair, and nightstands and not a lot of room for moving around the room but there was a very pleasant surprise. My room came with a large private balcony that seemed almost as large as the room itself. The balcony looked out at the backs of surrounding apartment buildings and you almost felt like a native sitting on your balcony enyoying the early evening as your neighbors were doing. The bathroom was also newly redone and had a nice tub/shower combination. The housekeepers did an excellent job everyday of maintaining the rooms. You also saw them cleaning the common areas of the hotel everyday as well. There is a safe in the room but you have to pay about 5 euros per day to get the lock. Breakfast was very good. If you hit the timing right, someone prepares bacon and eggs to order from the far left end of the restaurant. A buffet is set up to the right with all the standard European breakfast items. The hotel seems to have quite a few tour groups but you can check their schedules in the lobby in order to miss the crowds for breakfast. I ate lunch there the first day and it was OK but there are so many other possibilities, I wouldn't recommend anything but breakfast. I liked the location of the hotel. It is about 15 minutes by subway (line 1) to the heart of the city. It is in a regular neighborhood that is not overrun with throngs of tourists partying all night. If you want to be among the throngs, then the Aragon would not be for you. I enjoyed walking around the neighborhood and buying fruit, cheese, bread and pastries from local shops to cut down on food costs. There is a huge supermarket in a mall near the Glories subway stop (the first stop toward the city center) but it is walkable from the hotel. Just look for the big dill pickle shaped building down the street. The front desk staff seemed somewhat reserved but answered questions and offered advice when asked. All seemed to handle English pretty well and didn't laugh at my attempts at Spanish. The gentleman at check out was particularly helpful. All in all, if you want a hotel that is close to, but not in the middle of all the hubub of Barcelona, and don't plan lots of late nights, the Aragon can be a good choice if you get a favorable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Under the average hotel”
Reviews.Author: aseretana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and 2005 but I didn't like the hotel. It was under renovation but we were put in the oldest part of the hotel, for sure. The room was nothing special (the worst I've been), small, old and the heater has been grabbed from the wall and there was dust in. The bathroom was much better and clean. Our friends had to change their room because the 1st one had a really strange smell and was dirty. The staff was really bad, un-helpful and, at breakfast, they were always looking at us as if we were going to steal food or something. They didn't offer to help with the luggage and gave us rooms located somewhere strange with no indications and, when we asked for help to find the rooms they were unpleasant. The breakfast was really good and with a wide choice and the "comedor" was new and with very good conditions. The hotel is far away from the heart of Barcelona, at night that zone is quite scary, all the shops are closed and with metal doors, so it is not very pleasant to walk there at night. The nearest Metro station os Clot, 5-10 minutes walking. The metro station was dirty and had no one at night. I think now the hotel is renovated but if I return to Barcelona I would not choose Catalonia Aragon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: ltkaplan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for almost a week during my honeymoon vacation. A three stars ranking hotel (after a full renovation recently) located in a quiet area, walking distance from the famous Sagrada Familia and from a metro station, which we later on used to go easily everywhere If you are intrested in more details please see: [--]

Reviews.Title: “Lovely city”
Reviews.Author: pollywollydoodle77
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Fly Globespan. Hotel is a bit far from the heart of the city, although the Clot Metro station is about 5 mins walk away, this metro line takes you to all the hussle and bussle in the heart of Barcelona. The room itself was a fairy average size, the beds were twin beds pushed together, The bathroom was a bit dated but served it's purpose well. The room walls are fairly thin and you can hear people walking above you on the wood floor. Outside the room it can be fairly busy first thing in the morning and the lift beeps everytime it opens. The buffet breakfast was very good and there was lots of choice. On the whole the staff were friendly and helpful enough. If I was to go toBarcelona again I would stay somewhere closer tto the centre itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: hutchbeast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend recently and thought the hotel was great. We paid £77.50 per night altogether which included a large buffet breakfast every day which was very impressive. There was everything you can think of, both hot (omlettes, bacon, sausages in particular) and cold (croissants, many pastries etc) and coffees, espressos etc. This was easily the best choice of breakfast I've seen yet and much better than the 4 and 5 star hotels I've been to have to offer. The bedroom itself was alright, nice decor and a decent size. The bathroom was good, especially the large shower wet room which had a powerful shower. We stayed on the 4th floor so had to use the lift and there was no problems with the lift. The location was also quite good, a couple of minutes walk from Clot metro station which takes you to places such as Sagrada Familia, Nou Camp and Placa Catalunya within minutes. I would say the area is alright and fairly safe but always be aware of those around you just like in any other major European city and use your common sense and you'll be fine. The metro in the city is excellent...you can get to the beach fairly easily also. The hotel can get fairly noisy at times mainly because the floor is marbled for instance when people are coming in at night but don't let you put this off staying there as every other hotel I've ever stayed in have been the same. The walls are quite thin also but I think this is just common in hotels...we hardly stayed in the hotel so it really wasn't a problem for us so don't let it put you off, the positives easily outweigh the negatives. I would highly recommend this place especially for couples, friends and families.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible elevator...”
Reviews.Author: Sbraga
Reviews.Content: The room was fine as well as the location of the hotel (not too far from city centre). However, there were 2 big problems disappointing me: noise on the outside and a constant beeping from the elevator door throughout the night whenever the door opened. Overall, i didn't get much sleep because of this so i'm disappointed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will not be back...”
Reviews.Author: JMSSENA
Reviews.Content: passed three nights in the Catalonia Aragon with my wife in the beggining of June. I sent an email for the hotel asking prices but not receive any answer.A day before leavong, I call directly to the hotel and receive the price of the stay. As soon as I arrive to the Hotel, I was informed that the value that me envoys by email (still expecting the answer..) was lower then the one gave by phone. The price was 93 € by night. In the check out the price was the double and if it wasn´t the fact that I had written the correct price I would have to pay the double. The hotel in itself is nothing of special. Of early morning, we were awake with beaten fortresses in the doors in other levels and people walking in the correddors and there were many teenagers that at night did a lot noise. The elevators did not function correctly and the doorman that was on the door did not know to give any usefull information to you . The breakfast was the more razoavel of our stay. The hotel is not properly well located for who is going to be nearby the center. In the exit I asked the price of a taxi for the airport and informed myself that was more or less 40 € and called a taxi. I opted for go in a taxi that passed in the street and led myself only 20 €. The persons of the staff are unpleasant and do not have a lot will in collaborate with . Finally, it is a hotel for which I am not going to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing nights”
Reviews.Author: Sannikka
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this foel, that we found thanks to Trip Adviser´s tips! We were excpecting ok-hotel, but find out that deal was excellent! Nights only 69 €, rooms really big, clean, comftorable, own balcon and big marbel bathroom! Best thing was that the hotel was really quite, no noise, and so nice long sleeps. The location is quite good, because metro is so close. Once we took breakfast and it was really worth of 12 €. I can only recommend! :) Sanni from Finland

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: scottishtraveller74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and would definately go back for a return visit. It is situated in a residential part of Barcelona but is easy access to a metro station. The room was very clean and a decent size and breakfasts were really nice. Our airline did not book a room for us as they were requested to do but the receptionist called the airline after letting us check in and sorted it all out. Barcelona itself is great - I have never been but will definately be going back in the not to distant future. The transport system is extremely cheap and reliable . We would recommend getting the train into the centre of barcelona from the airport and £1 for 2 people it is wll worth it. Buy the T10 ticket at the station at the airport and thats all it will cost you to get to your hotel as you dont get charged again for inter changing at the metro. If your looking for a nice relaxing break then this is the hotel and city for you

Reviews.Title: “so clean”
Reviews.Author: memeber
Reviews.Content: have just spent 3 nights at this hotel and apart from rooms being quite small they were very clean and modern. Staff in this hotel are so nice, friendly and extremely helpful.good location as nice shops and bars away from La Rambla but 5 stops on metro to centre of town which took minutes and metro about 2 mins from hotel...would def stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonly priced”
Reviews.Author: LeovanderVlist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nigtht. It is a business type of hotel, but seems to be used most by tourist. Personel is not very open and friendly, but overall comfort is ok. Location is good, with Clot Metros station at less than five minutes walking. Paid € 55 excl breakfast, which is cheap for the comfort and the location

Reviews.Title: “Pleaseant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is OK. Clean. Good A/C. Enough room and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: IrelandMichelle
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a short stay in this hotel. We found it to be very clean and we really enjoyed our time there. The breakfast was excellent. We ate in the hotel one night, the meal was lovely but the menu was a bit limited and the menu stayed the same for each night of our stay. We stayed in a room on the seventh floor which was very quiet and thankfully there was air conditioning and a lift. There is bar which remains open until 12 but it was very quiet. There are also 2 computer that I saw available for use. You insert €2 into the machine and you get 10 minutes internet time. This was very handy in order to check up flight times etc. The staff did not speak much english but were very good for organising taxi's to take us where we wanted to go. It is a good walk to the city centre, we did walk once but it is quite a distance in the heat so it was much easier to flag down a taxi. There wasn't alot to do in the immediate area but it was only a short walk from the Sagrada Famillia. Overall, our stay was very enjoyable and I would definately recommend it to people for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: cdhailey
Reviews.Content: This hotel was adequate for our travel needs. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was good. The hotel staff was not always helpful and the location isn't the greatest because it's kinda far from all the major sights. So although you may save money, you may end up paying more for public transportation. There is a good restaurant right down the street from it owned by a husband and wife. She cooks meals to order and they are very helpful and have lots of tips for tourist. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No frills Barcelona Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShanaAFolk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location - easy access to a metro stop where two metro lines intersect - very convienant for touring! The room is small but adequate. The mattress was as hard as a rock, but if you don't mind a fim mattress, then you won't have any complaints. The hotel is modern and clean and has a nice breakfast buffet. But you better come prepared - the staff is of little help, whether you need a restaurant recommendation, directions to the train station or simply a wake up call, the staff can't be bothered. We had prepaid our stay and the desk clerk was insistant that we still owed for the room - thankfully we brought the email paperwork and conformation info... be sure that you have proof if you prepay! The hotel doesn't offer any extras, and for the price, it seemed to underdeliver. But if you are looking for a clean place to stay and you plan to be out touring, not inside the hotel with the "less than friendly" staff, this hotel will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: tanteloulou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two of our friends had booked the Catalonia Aragon because of past favorable reviews. We were very pleased that we did as it offered us great accomodations, close to the metro, lots of little shops and restaurants nearby and a great breakfast that would begin our day on a good note. The rooms were very clean, the water was hot and the shower had lots of pressure. The bathrooms were stocked everyday with essentials. Most of the rooms seem to face the street and it was quite noisy, but we found that if we closed the windows it solved the problem. The day we arrived, after nearly 20 hours of travelling, we were very early and did not think we would get to check in right away, but we were pleasantly surprised when we were handed the keys. If we ever return to Barcelona, we would stay there again. L. Baldwin - Vancouver British Columbia, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: galonthemove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights this month. The breakfast was very good, good pineapple. The room was clean, the desk staff cordial. I did notice they don't greet you as you come and go by the desk. I thought that was rude, being trained in the hotel field. I also thought it would be helpful if the hotel had maps available of the neighborhood instead of just saying, "go out of the hotel, turn right and walk 7 blocks to get to La Sagrada". I'm not sure I'd stay there again on my own, this hotel was included in our package.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NJtravelor10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Catalonia Aragon for 3 nights last month (November 2005). Clean, stylish rooms. Front Desk was extremely helpful with our lost luggage problem. Not in center of town, but nearby metro and train to airport. And as others have stated- a great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,shame about the bar!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i stayed in this hotel for my 50th birthday trip. We were there for 3nights and found it very convenient to metro station,2/3 mins.away. We found some nice,small and friendly local bars very nearby where one could easily get a snack of bocadillo or tortilla as well as something more than that if required. We walked from the hotel to Sagrada Familia quite easily on our first night. On Friday and Saturday,we got a metro within 10mins or so to Placa Catalunya and then hopped on the Bus Turistica for fantastic tours around the whole city. On Friday night,we returned on the metro to take in the ambiance of Las Ramblas,returning with no bother from the nearby metro station which took us back to our area in 3 stops. The room was spacious enough and well fitted out as was the bathroom with plenty of 'goodies'laid on. We had a meal in the restaurant on Saturday evening which was very disappointing after the meals we had had in other places in barcelona. The service was poor and the food adequate. The bar service was abysmal totally. When it was open and staffed,they did not know much about drinks!it was hard to get someone to serve us and this was not late by any means.It's nice to have a nightcap back at one's hotel before retiring,this it seems is not allowed in Hotel Catalonia Aragon!! Overall,I would recommend it but do your drinking and eating elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: volsung37
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Aragon for 3 nights at the beginning of November. We paid around £70 per night for a double room. Place very clean although the layout can be a bit confusing on arrival. Floors seem to be split so that you have to find out which lift to take up. But the best thing about the hotel is the breakfasts. From 7.30 to 10.30 - buffet style. Lots of choice and no limits on the amount you can eat. Excellent fare too. The hotel location is a little out from the centre but its only a hundred metres or so from Clot metro station with links to all parts of Barcelona. My partner found the crowds at Catalunya metro intimidating but hey its a big city! Full marks for economy, style and service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the hotel for 4 nights.I found a couple of things that could be improved on. The hotel Service was very bad.Very unhelpful and a lot of english speaking tourists were staying there and most of the people working behind recption had very poor english. Rooms are very small and do stink of smoke as well. The Area itself is not too bad.But if you are heading back to your hotel after 1am get a Taxi home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Elvis2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August 2005 and couldnt fault it. Location is superb - 3 min walk to Clot metro and rail stations. The rail station takes you directly to the airport in 25 mins for a mere 2 Euros a head! To the main La Rambla area takes about 15 mins. There is also a huge shopping centre called Diagonal Glories a 10 min walk from the hotel, near the Glories metro station and close to a large glass building which looks like the gherkin in London - for all shopping requirements as well as restaurants. The breakfast at the hotel was superb - a full range of hot and cold. The rooms were modern, clean and comfortable, and each room had aircon and a great high pressure shower. The hotel is in a quiet area which is good when you need to get some sleep at the end of a long day sightseeing. We would definately look at staying at this hotel again on future trips to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, good breakfast and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Romina A
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced business hotel in 'Clot 'only 3 metro stops from Sagrada Familia and its easy and cheap to get to all the sites with a metro pass. Very trendy and tasteful, we got a big room with a TV, big wardrobe and a great bathroom. The hotel generally is spotless. Breakfast has plenty on offer , though you will have to get up early to get the bacon! The chef's are happy to cook you an egg or bacon how you like on request. The maid came round daily to clean and with fresh towels . The location is what I would call a local residetial area, quiet at night and plenty of little local shops if you need any urgent essentials.The metro less than 5 mins walk away. So if you're a couple or friends who want a very nice affordable place to stay away from the crowds of hen and stag parties in la Rambla, this is perfect. The metro runs till 2am sat and sun so no problems if you want a night out.Otherwise cabs are cheap, if you want a drop out/into the centre of town, so I wouldn't worry about getting to Clot. I read the bad reviews and these were obviously going on when the hotel was being renovated so I can only say, its great now. It certainly feels superior to a three star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wait til they get it renovated”
Reviews.Author: rcohoon
Reviews.Content: I would wait until this hotel finishes its renovations before I went here. The neighborhood is rather seedy and I didn't feel safe having my students out at night in it. It has no public phone and the staff was very rude and unhelpful to our tour director. Meals were average at best. The hotel didn't even bother to clean up the dust from renovations so floor was slippery.

Reviews.Title: “On Point”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel!. I went there with a couple of girlfriends to get a break and what a break we got! the hotel was clean, peaceful, and just what we needed. It does however, get very hot in the summer and though the hotel boasts of air-conditioning it doesnt work to the desired effect....Full Blast!. The hotel is ideal for tourists, students and those who want a weekend break from the hustle and bustle of London. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Building site”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from Barcelona, what a beautiful city!!! but cannot say the same about the Aragon. We arrived at the hotel around 7.00pm our hearts fell when we saw the buliling site outside the hotel. At reception there were buckets and towel on floor to catch water from a leaking roof. Our room was new and very clean. We rang down for room service and the only thing available was salad sandwiches. We then tried the restaraunt the only thing available was a buffet of salad, cold sausages and cold fish this cost us 30 euro for two. Next morning at 7.00 am the building work commenced hammering and drilling, no need for an alarm clock. The hotel was too far out and after a long day sight-seeing the hotel offered poor choice of food and not even a lounge to enjoy a relaxing drink.

Reviews.Title: “got back today”
Reviews.Author: karandal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights at the Catalonia Aragon. Booked the trip as a present for my husband but was a bit worried after reading the reviews on the site. There was no need to I'm glad to say. We arrived about 11pm, the girl on reception was perfectly pleasant and polite the whole time- she even smiled more than once- contrary to the info on other reviews. The hotel is built around a corner and some of the rooms can be difficult to find. We couldn't find ours but just went back to reception to ask and someone came with us. The public areas of the hotel have seen a bit better days, but they are trying to tidy them up a bit. There was notice in reception to this effect and one of the walls was painted while we were there. Some of the public areas are also being used as store rooms for mattresses and towels. I didn't mention it to any of the staff so don't know whether this is usual or not. The rooms themselves are fine, ours wasn't huge but there was plenty of room for two of us, everything was clean and tidy, the bed was comfy, loads of hot water, the heating control worked and the maid gave us clean towels and new toiletries every day. Breakfast was 7.30 to 10.30 every day and 7.30 til 11 am on Sunday. There was everything you could want to eat and more both hot & cold. The staff in the restaurant smiled too! Not much in the way of bars and restaurants right by the hotel but you pass plenty if you walk 2 streets back from the hotel toward Segrada Familia. For the price I paid I believe I got good value and would be happy to stay here again. The only drawback was the distance from the ramblas, place catalunya etc. We tended to have breakfast and leave for the day and just came back after our evening meal about 11pm. Had we been staying a bit more central we may have gone back to the hotel late afternoon for a bit of a rest. But instead we had to find a bar with some tasty tapas and a smooth red wine.... such hardship!

Reviews.Title: “OK but would not go back”
Reviews.Author: MNP75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the center of Barcelona but the Clot metro and train station is within a 3 minutes walk. This makes travel to the airport, city center and nearby towns and resorts quick. You can also get to the hotel from Ramblas for about 6 euro (with day tarrif). Surroundings of the hotel were a bit suspicious as the streets were not well lit and were empty after midnight although we did not have any problems. Room was very small and simple with shabby furniture which reminded me Soviet hotels (defintely not the best memories I wanted to have). Breakfast was good with fresh pastry which is baked in the hotel. Staff was OK but not too firendly. Overall, the hotel did not spoil our enjoyment with Barcelona but I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, will not use again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights (late August 2004). Found the staff hard work and not very helpful. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. MAKE SURE you get your breakfast early as we were refused breakfast 20 minutes before it was supposed to close. TIP: Take a map out with you, as some taxi drivers could not find the place, then drop you off in the wrong area. Maps are available in reception. A bit out of the way but the location is close to the metro 'Clot'.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid in the summer”
Reviews.Author: Howardedinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night with my family in late July after reading favourable reviews on this site. My advice would be to avoid this hotel in summer. The room was tiny for two people let alone for the three of us. Although basically clean the walls were desperately in need of being repainted, the air conditioning was ineffective and horrendously noisy so that we hardly slept at all. Window wouldn't open as the handle was broken (along with most of the air conditioning controls) but the loud traffic noise at the front would have made an open window probably too noisy. Reasonable breakfast, convenient luggage storage and closesnees to Clot station did not make up for the lack of sleep.
